required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety Study of Tung's Acupuncture for Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety Study of Tung's Acupuncture for Improving Ovarian Function of Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome: a Randomised Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine

clinical_study.source: Beijing Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety in improving ovarian function of polycystic ovarian syndrome in adults. Half of patients will receive Tung's acupuncture therapy, while the other half will receive Diane-35(CPA/EE) as the control group.

detailed_description.textblock: Both Tung's acupuncture therapy and Diane-35(CPA/EE) could improve the symptom of patients with polycystic ovarian syndrome, but until now there is no definite evidence to indicate acupuncture could play the same role in improving ovarian function. So we design this study to observe the change of follicular development, ovary size and sex hormone( testosterone, follitropin, luteinizing hormone) before and after the treatment, and evaluate the efficacy and safty of acupuncture.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study was a randomized, drug-controlled, and parallel group trial

primary_outcome.measure: Change in LH/FSH Ratio From Baseline to the End of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: the change in LH/FSH ratio, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in LH/FSH Ratio From Baseline to the 24th Week
secondary_outcome.description: the change in LH/FSH ratio, values at the 24th week minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in LH From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: changes in luteinizing hormone(LH), values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in FSH From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: changes in follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH), values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Body Mass Index (BMI) From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: the changes in BMI, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Total Testosterone (TT) From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: changes in total testosterone (TT) , values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Ovarian Volume From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: changes in ovarian volume, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Polycystic Ovary Number From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: the changes in polycystic ovary number, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Number of Bleeding Events From Baseline to the End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the number of bleeding events, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline

arm_group.description: The Tung's acupuncture group received acupuncture treatments twice per week for 12 weeks. The study took Tung's acupoints as main acupuncture points, which were Fuke, Huanchao, Tianhuang, Renhuang, as well as the traditional acupoints Guanyuan (CV4) and Zigong (EX-CA1).

Cyproterone acetate/ethinylestradiol (CPA/EE) was taken orally one tablet per day from the 8th day of menstrual cycle or any day for patients with amenorrhea. The pills were administered for 21 days consecutively. The patients then stopped taking the pills for seven days and, on the eighth day, continued to take the pills again for three menstrual cycles (28 day cycles).

intervention.description: The study took Tung's acupoints as main acupuncture points, which were Fuke, Huanchao, Tianhuang, Renhuang, as well as the traditional acupoints Guanyuan (CV4) and Zigong (EX-CA1).

Cyproterone acetate/ethinylestradiol (CPA/EE) contains 2mg cyproterone acetate (an anti-androgenic progestin) and 0.035mg ethinylestradiol (CPA/EE). The pills were administered for 21 days consecutively. The patients then stopped taking the pills for seven days and, on the eighth day, continued to take the pills again for three menstrual cycles (28 day cycles).

facility.name: Beijing Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine

patient_data.ipd_description: to share data by publishing paper
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: after the paper published around the year of 2020
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: researchers who are interested in this area

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited through advertisements on local newspapers and posters.Of the 116 individuals who were initially recruited for this trial, 56 were excluded,sixty participants were randomly assigned to acupuncture group (n = 30) or CPA/EE group (n = 30).

group.title: Tung's Acupuncture Group
group.description: The study took Tung's acupoints as main acupuncture points, which were Fuke, Huanchao, Tianhuang, Renhuang, as well as the traditional acupoints Guanyuan (CV4) and Zigong (EX-CA1).

group.title: CPA/EE Group
group.description: CPA/EE were administered for 21 days consecutively. The patients then stopped taking the pills for seven days and, on the eighth day, continued to take the pills again for three menstrual cycles (28 day cycles).

group.title: Tung's Acupuncture
group.description: The Tung's acupuncture group received acupuncture treatments twice per week for 12 weeks. The study took Tung's acupoints as main acupuncture points, which were Fuke, Huanchao, Tianhuang, Renhuang, as well as the traditional acupoints Guanyuan (CV4) and Zigong (EX-CA1).

group.title: CPA/EE
group.description: Cyproterone acetate/ethinylestradiol (CPA/EE) was taken orally one tablet per day from the 8th day of menstrual cycle or any day for patients with amenorrhea. The pills were administered for 21 days consecutively. The patients then stopped taking the pills for seven days and, on the eighth day, continued to take the pills again for three menstrual cycles (28 day cycles).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in LH/FSH Ratio From Baseline to the End of Treatment
outcome.description: the change in LH/FSH ratio, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline
outcome.population: Sixty participants were randomly assigned to acupuncture group (n = 30) or CPA/EE group (n = 30). During the study period, one participant in the acupuncture group withdrew because of living far away from hospital, two participants in the CPA/EE group withdrew because of taking other medicine and health reason.

group.title: Tung's Acupuncture
group.description: The Tung's acupuncture group received acupuncture treatments twice per week for 12 weeks. The study took Tung's acupoints as main acupuncture points, which were Fuke, Huanchao, Tianhuang, Renhuang, as well as the traditional acupoints Guanyuan (CV4) and Zigong (EX-CA1).

The pills were administered for 21 days consecutively. The patients then stopped taking the pills for seven days and, on the eighth day, continued to take the pills again for three menstrual cycles (28 day cycles).

measure.title: Change in LH/FSH Ratio From Baseline to the End of Treatment
measure.description: the change in LH/FSH ratio, values after 12-week treatment minus the values at baseline
measure.population: Sixty participants were randomly assigned to acupuncture group (n = 30) or CPA/EE group (n = 30). During the study period, one participant in the acupuncture group withdrew because of living far away from hospital, two participants in the CPA/EE group withdrew because of taking other medicine and health reason.

outcome.title: Change in LH/FSH Ratio From Baseline to the 24th Week
outcome.description: the change in LH/FSH ratio, values at the 24th week minus the values at baseline
outcome.population: During the long-term observation, three participants in the acupuncture group withdrew because of living far away from hospital, pregnancy and taking other medicine. Five participants in the CPA/EE group withdrew because of taking other medicine,pregnancy, losting contact and health reason.

reported_events.desc: No serious adverse event happened, eleven adverse mild events were descriped in the data tables below.

group.title: Tung's Acupuncture Group
group.description: The study took Tung's acupoints as main acupuncture points, which were Fuke, Huanchao, Tianhuang, Renhuang, as well as the traditional acupoints Guanyuan (CV4) and Zigong (EX-CA1).

event.sub_title: Transient bruises at the sites of needle insertion

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Beijing Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine
